result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley Swan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no illegal drugs.

timeConds.notes: with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 02/05/2016 by 5pm.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (18 pages) commencing 1/28/2016 received and filed.
per court reporter request
Decision and Order DENYING Request for Good Time Credit signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Order For Cancellation of Huber/ Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Witkowiak, Br 22 for review. os
Bail Refund Packets
2/2/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

At to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.   
Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 12 Months condition time at the House of Corrections with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 02/05/2016 by 5pm.  
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no illegal drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Court stayed commencement until 02/05/2016.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is in Court for Status Conference.  Case remains calendared for Sentence on January 28, 2016 in Br. 22.

At the courts request, and with consent of both parties, sentencing is moved from 01/26/2016 at 1:30am to 01/28/2016 at 8:30am.  Defendant is still required to check in with the court on 01/26/2016 at 1:30pm.

Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 01/11/2016 is vacated.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden. Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.
Court ordered charge amended to Manufacture/Delivery Controlled Substance (Heroin) (>3-10 grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1)(d)2 and 939.50(3)(e), a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
This assignment is only effective as of August 3, 2015.  aw

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel still needs an offer and additional discovery.  Defense counsel wants to see if DNA has been tested.  Defendant needs to supply a bucco swab for DNA testing to be done.  Attorney Renden to talk with client to see if he wants to provide a DNA sample after court today.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22, in room 608 of the court house.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.   Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and   dangerous weapons.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stanley Swan in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Danielle Chojnacki for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  (Scheduling Conference date set at a later date, as Defense Counsel will be on vacation and wishes scheduling date to be set with co-defendant case that was adjourned for a later Preliminary Hearing date.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense counsel's Motion to DISMISS the criminal complaint was DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
